alert.note: Alert for Borden; Crane; Dawson; Ector; Glasscock; Howard; Martin; Midland; Mitchell; Pecos; Reagan; Scurry; Terrell; Upton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued January 17 at 2:07AM CST until January 18 at 7:00PM CST by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR RELATIVE HUMIDITY AROUND 15%, 20FT WINDS OF 20 MPH OR GREATER, AND VERY HIGH FIRE DANGER FOR THE EASTERN AND CENTRAL PERMIAN BASIN AND LOWER TRANS PECOS... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR RELATIVE HUMIDITY AROUND 15%, 20FT WINDS OF 20 MPH OR GREATER, AND VERY HIGH FIRE DANGER FOR THE EASTERN AND CENTRAL PERMIAN BASIN AND LOWER TRANS PECOS... * AFFECTED AREA...Dawson, Borden, Scurry, Martin, Howard, Mitchell, Ector, Midland, Glasscock, Crane, Upton, Reagan, Pecos and Terrell. * TIMING...Wednesday afternoon through Wednesday evening. * WINDS...West 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 15 percent. * RFTI...4 or near critical. * IMPACTS...Avoid the use of open flames or any activities that may generate sparks. Accidental ignitions may have the potential to grow into dangerous wind-driven wildfires.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.

area.areaDesc: Borden; Crane; Dawson; Ector; Glasscock; Howard; Martin; Midland; Mitchell; Pecos; Reagan; Scurry; Terrell; Upton
